artist: Decorator: Christophe-Ferdinand Caron; Manufacturer: Sèvres Porcelain Factory
description: Presented by Emperor Napoleon the First to Prince William of Prussia in 1808; painted with scenes from the Fables of La Fontaine
inscription: On bottom: Le Lion et le Moucheron | L\'Elephant et le Singe de Jupiter
markings: Stamped on bottom: M.Imp te de Sèvres, 7
text: The Emperor Napoleon commissioned this service in 1807 and presented it to Prince William of Prussia in September, 1808. Each piece of the set, called a cabaret, is decorated with at least one scene derived from Jean de la Fontaine's (1621-95) Fables.  The high quality of all the painted scenes marks this service as one of Christophe-Ferdinand Caron's greatest achievements while working as an animal painter at Sevres between 1792 and 1815.  Caron studied plants at the botanical gardens in Paris as well as books on various animals and birds to create detailed scenes of the fables.  Stories illustrated on the set include the tortoise and the hare and the fox and the stork.
title: Teapot from a tea service for twelve
